financial statements.</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">5</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s14DB095C6A015983B4FDE7E6FAB0CC7C"></a></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">PTC Inc.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(unaudited)</span></div><div><a id="sAFB4E403435A541D8916ABF1F0E27463"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">1. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-EF695C30CDA557FC8C2771AF02D3DA93-0-wk-Fact-EB5F46CD18B457528C7701D6039CA2F7" continuedAt="TextSelection-EF695C30CDA557FC8C2771AF02D3DA93-1" escape="true">Basis of Presentation</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-EF695C30CDA557FC8C2771AF02D3DA93-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-EF695C30CDA557FC8C2771AF02D3DA93-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">General</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements include the accounts of PTC Inc. and its wholly owned subsidiaries and have been prepared by management in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (U.S. GAAP) and in accordance with the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission regarding interim financial reporting. Accordingly, they do not include all the information and footnotes required by generally accepted accounting principles for complete financial statements.  While we believe that the disclosures presented are adequate in order to make the information not misleading, these unaudited quarterly financial statements should be read in conjunction with our annual consolidated financial statements and related notes included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  In the opinion of management, the accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements contain all adjustments, consisting only of those of a normal recurring nature, necessary for a fair statement of our financial position, results of operations and cash flows at the dates and for the periods indicated.  The </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> Consolidated Balance Sheet included herein is derived from our audited consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Unless otherwise indicated, all references to a year mean our fiscal year, which ends on September&#160;30.  Our fiscal quarters end on a Saturday following a thirteen-week calendar and may result in different quarter end dates year to year.  The </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> quarter of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> ended on </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> quarter of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> ended on </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  The results of operations for the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> are not necessarily indicative of the results expected for the remainder of the fiscal year.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Recently Adopted Accounting Pronouncements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;padding-left:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Leases</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In February 2016, the FASB issued Accounting Standard Update (ASU) 2016-02, Leases (Topic 842) (ASC 842), which replaced the existing guidance in ASC 840, Leases. The updated standard aims to increase transparency and comparability among organizations by requiring lessees to recognize lease assets and lease liabilities on the balance sheet and to disclose important information about leasing arrangements.  We adopted ASC 842 effective October 1, 2019 (the effective date).  ASC 842 requires a modified retrospective transition method that could either be applied at the earliest comparative period in the financial statements or in the period of adoption.  We elected to use the period of adoption (October 1, 2019) transition method and therefore did not recast prior periods.  Since we adopted the new standard using the period of adoption transition method, we are not required to present 2020 comparative disclosures under ASC 842.  However, we are required to present the required annual disclosures under the previous U.S. GAAP lease accounting standard (ASC 840).</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We elected the package of practical expedients as permitted under the transition guidance, which allowed us: (1) to carry forward the historical lease classification; (2) not to reassess whether expired or existing contracts are or contain leases; and, (3) not to reassess the treatment of initial direct costs for existing leases.  In addition, we elected an accounting policy to not recognize leases with an initial term of one year or less on the balance sheet.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Upon the adoption of this standard on October 1, 2019, we recognized an operating lease liability of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88319913e442-wk-Fact-3FB09D8CCBF6E203F4A3802CE6101030" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="I2020Q1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">224.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, representing the present value of the minimum lease payments remaining as of the adoption date, and a right-of-use asset in the amount of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88319913e446-wk-Fact-59F739D22F3B0C5329BC802D4DCD5B10" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="I2020Q1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">167.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  The right-of-use asset reflects adjustments for derecognition of deferred leasing incentives.  We also recorded a </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88319913e450-wk-Fact-08E0BAF95493315C636BC3B076D2DC2C" name="us-gaap:CumulativeEffectOfNewAccountingPrincipleInPeriodOfAdoption" contextRef="I2020Q1_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member_us-gaap_StatementEquityComponentsAxis_us-gaap_RetainedEarningsMember_us-gaap_UnusualOrInfrequentItemAxis_pmtc_SchedulingofreversaloftemporarytaxdifferencesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.6</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> decrease to retained earnings as a result of the change in scheduling of reversal of temporary tax differences due to the adoption of ASC 842.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Derivative Financial Instruments</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">6</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-EF695C30CDA557FC8C2771AF02D3DA93-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In August 2017, the FASB issued ASU 2017-12,&#160;"Derivatives and Hedging (Topic 815) Targeted Improvements to Accounting for Hedging Activities", which amends and simplifies existing guidance to allow companies to more accurately present the economic effects of risk management activities in the financial statements.  We adopted ASU 2017-12 effective October 1, 2019 (the effective date).  Adoption of this guidance in the first quarter of fiscal 2020 did not have an impact on our consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Pending Accounting Pronouncements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Goodwill and Other&#8212;Internal-Use Software</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In August 2018, the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update (ASU) 2018-15,&#160;Intangibles&#8212;Goodwill and Other&#8212;Internal-Use Software (Subtopic 350-40): Customer's Accounting for Implementation Costs Incurred in a Cloud Computing Arrangement That is a Service Contract,&#160;which&#160;aligns the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs in cloud computing arrangements with the requirements for capitalizing implementation costs incurred to develop or obtain internal-use software. The new standard will be effective for us in the first quarter of 2021.  Entities can choose to adopt the new guidance prospectively or retrospectively.  We plan to adopt this standard using the prospective adoption approach.  We are currently evaluating the effects of this pronouncement on our consolidated financial statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Fair Value Measurement</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In August 2018, the FASB issued ASU 2018-13,&#160;Fair Value Measurement (Topic 820): Disclosure Framework&#8212;Changes to the Disclosure Requirements for Fair Value Measurement,&#160;which eliminates, modifies and adds disclosure requirements for fair value measurements.  The new standard will be effective for us in the first quarter of 2021.  We do not expect this ASU to have a material impact on our consolidated financial statements.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><a id="s0249309640625957AFB3982BF54D10BD"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">2. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:RevenueFromContractWithCustomerTextBlock" id="TextSelection-7C9386D467D75B8485E09987D088E350-0-wk-Fact-4D18B0525AE35FD981C9968CBB912147" continuedAt="TextSelection-7C9386D467D75B8485E09987D088E350-1" escape="true">Revenue from Contracts with Customers</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation name="us-gaap:DeferredRevenue" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">368,089</ix:nonFraction></span></span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td><td style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e499-wk-Fact-702B97C2DAEC55B49BB74D6C94925F77" name="us-gaap:DeferredRevenue" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">396,632</ix:nonFraction></span></span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;"><div style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td></tr></table></div><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, our contract assets are expected to be transferred to receivables within the next 12 months and therefore are included in other current assets.  Approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e517-wk-Fact-343A129E35D156A7AA366817BA756069" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerAssetReclassifiedToReceivable" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">6.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of the September 30, 2019 contract asset balance was transferred to receivables during the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> as a result of the right to payment becoming unconditional.  The majority of the contract asset balance relates to two large professional services contracts with invoicing terms based on performance milestones.  Additions to contract assets of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e530-wk-Fact-1BC3AC456775552AB2CF1AF67E54436D" name="pmtc:ContractwithCustomerAssetAdditionsduringPeriod" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">6.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> related to revenue recognized in the period, net of billings.  There were no impairments of contract assets during the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.   </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">During the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, we recognized </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e556-wk-Fact-1694F65FBFEF5010983B896144E8D7B0" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">178.2</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of revenue that was included in deferred revenue as of September 30, 2019 and there were additional deferrals of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e560-wk-Fact-BD58F1E5BFDF5D299E8C25A1555D0E90" name="us-gaap:DeferredRevenueAdditions" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">147.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> during the three months ended December 28, 2019, primarily related to new billings.  In addition, deferred revenue increased by </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e564-wk-Fact-314F9018F451C5913F00B0554CB6F518" name="us-gaap:DeferredRevenueAdditions" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_OnshapeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> as a result of the acquisition of Onshape.  The balance of total short- and long-term receivables as of September 30, 2019 was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e569-wk-Fact-00C1892EC8B1F3B2E55DB056960BF7C0" name="pmtc:ShortTermandLongTermAccountsReceivable" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">412.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, compared to total short- and long-term receivables as of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e577-wk-Fact-96C8BF51063C75AFBBCBB0570221F8FD" name="pmtc:ShortTermandLongTermAccountsReceivable" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">400.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our multi-year, non-cancellable on-premise subscription contracts provide customers with an annual right to exchange software within the subscription with other software.  Although the exchange right is limited to software products within a similar product grouping, the exchange right is not limited to products with substantially similar features and functionality as those originally delivered.  We determined that this right to exchange previously delivered software for different software represents variable consideration to be accounted for as a liability.  We have identified a standard portfolio of contracts with common characteristics and applied the expected value method of determining variable consideration associated with this right.  Additionally, where there are isolated situations that are outside of the standard portfolio of contracts due to contract size, longer contract duration, or other unique contractual terms, we use the most likely amount method to determine the amount of variable consideration.  In both circumstances, the variable consideration included in the transaction price is constrained to the extent it is probable that a significant reversal in the amount of cumulative revenue recognized will not occur </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">7</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-7C9386D467D75B8485E09987D088E350-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">when the uncertainty associated with the variable consideration is subsequently resolved.  As of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, the total refund liability was&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e595-wk-Fact-DBB0D828CE6DC5521126FBFAD2B890C9" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerRefundLiability" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">25.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e599-wk-Fact-2E019685FFC2B53A76F1FBFB012A362C" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerRefundLiability" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">22.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, primarily associated with the annual right to exchange on-premise subscription software.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Costs to Obtain or Fulfill a Contract</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We recognize an asset for the incremental costs of obtaining a contract with a customer if the benefit of those costs is expected to be longer than one year.  These deferred costs (primarily commissions) are amortized proportionately related to revenue over five years, which is generally longer than the term of the initial contract because of anticipated renewals as commissions for renewals are not commensurate with commissions related to our initial contracts.  As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, deferred costs of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e619-wk-Fact-D7EBCB46952A50998C46610818595993" name="us-gaap:CapitalizedContractCostNet" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_BalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaap_OtherCurrentAssetsMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">29.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88320446e623-wk-Fact-CFD38470556F8051896BB9A5AB304931" name="us-gaap:CapitalizedContractCostNet" contextRef="FI2019Q4_us-gaap_BalanceSheetLocationAxis_us-gaap_OtherCurrentAssetsMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">27.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, were Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Restructuring Charges</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">During the first quarter of 2020, we initiated a voluntary restructuring program as part of a realignment associated with expected synergies and operational efficiencies related to the Onshape acquisition.  During the three months ended December 28, 2019, we incurred </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e417-wk-Fact-2F9195EFFE95DEC0A5C6B9B0777EA00E" name="us-gaap:RestructuringCharges" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_RestructuringPlan2020Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">13.6</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of an estimated </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e421-wk-Fact-4723A108AE1EC845F954D9E2857767F6" name="pmtc:TotalestimatedrestructuringchargesFY20" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_RestructuringPlan2020Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">21.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> charge in connection with this restructuring plan for termination benefits associated with approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e425-wk-Fact-FD939C5A3E5A6CF44A09B9B2B3F6E34E" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostNumberOfPositionsEliminated" contextRef="FD2019Q4YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_RestructuringPlan2020Member" unitRef="employee" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">175</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> employees.  We are estimating </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e429-wk-Fact-7972C6B20856BCA00752D9E2973BA061" name="pmtc:TotalestimatedrestructuringchargesFY20" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_RestructuringPlan2020Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">30</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of total restructuring charges in 2020. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">During the first quarter of 2019, we initiated a restructuring plan to realign our workforce to shift investment to support Industrial Internet of Things and Augmented Reality strategic high growth opportunities.  As this was a realignment of resources rather than a cost-savings initiative, it did not result in significant cost savings.  The restructuring plan was completed in the first quarter of 2019 and resulted in restructuring charges of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e436-wk-Fact-9BB3381F67BD53D0954EEE15CB4DD20F" name="us-gaap:RestructuringCharges" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_RestructuringPlan2019Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">16.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> for termination benefits associated with approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e440-wk-Fact-78154F843D90588883325219235645A4" name="us-gaap:RestructuringAndRelatedCostNumberOfPositionsEliminated" contextRef="FD2019Q1YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_EmployeeSeveranceMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_RestructuringPlan2019Member" unitRef="employee" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">240</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> employees, substantially all of which has been paid. continuedAt="TextSelection-335A72D6A9DB524092150AB4C5D2686D-4"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Other - Headquarters Relocation Charges</span></div></ix:continuation><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-335A72D6A9DB524092150AB4C5D2686D-4" continuedAt="TextSelection-335A72D6A9DB524092150AB4C5D2686D-5"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Headquarters relocation charges represent other expenses associated with exiting our prior Needham headquarters facility and relocating to our new worldwide headquarters in the Boston Seaport District.  In the first </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of 2019, we recorded</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;color:#ff0000;">&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88321724e1438-wk-Fact-58D079FFE9CC5CF9B1A1B1F6A7C1FF30" name="us-gaap:Depreciation" contextRef="FD2019Q1YTD_us-gaap_RestructuringCostAndReserveAxis_us-gaap_FacilityClosingMember_us-gaap_RestructuringPlanAxis_pmtc_PriorHeadquartersMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span></ix:continuation><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-335A72D6A9DB524092150AB4C5D2686D-5">&#160;of accelerated depreciation expense related to shortening the estimated useful lives of leasehold improvements related to the Needham location.</ix:continuation> </span></div><div><a id="sF01DCF8CD46F557C83319E37FA135752"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">4. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:DisclosureOfCompensationRelatedCostsShareBasedPaymentsTextBlock" id="TextSelection-8F6F8B681B585683AA72A1BB17CC71DD-0-wk-Fact-DF5EC510767A53838F1862EE87E18BF9" continuedAt="TextSelection-8F6F8B681B585683AA72A1BB17CC71DD-1" escape="true">Stock-based Compensation</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-8F6F8B681B585683AA72A1BB17CC71DD-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-8F6F8B681B585683AA72A1BB17CC71DD-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our equity incentive plan provides for grants of nonqualified and incentive stock options, common stock, restricted stock, restricted stock units (RSUs) and stock appreciation rights to employees, directors, officers and consultants.  We award RSUs as the principal equity incentive awards, including performance-based awards that are earned based on achievement of performance criteria established by the Compensation Committee of our Board of Directors.  Each RSU represents the contingent right to receive </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e365-wk-Fact-D4FFAE811323581AB65BA2C3E43CBB6D" name="pmtc:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardEquityInstrumentsOtherThanOptionsCommonStockIssuablePerRestrictedStockUnit" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="shares_per_unit" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">one</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> share of our common stock.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">For performance-based awards, we recognize stock-based compensation based on expected achievement of performance criteria.  We measure the cost of employee services received in exchange for RSU awards based on the fair value of the RSU awards on the date of grant.  That cost is recognized over the period during which an employee is required to provide service in exchange for the award.  We account for forfeitures as they occur, rather than estimate expected forfeitures.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our employee stock purchase plan (ESPP) allows eligible employees to contribute up to&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e375-wk-Fact-BBCDA48EE16F59F7B87F1439B5E2BFA2" name="pmtc:ESPPmaximumcontributionpercentage" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">10</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;of their base salary, up to a maximum of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e379-wk-Fact-05568996FF115F9F9F1F3172EAF0629F" name="pmtc:ESPPmaximumcontributionamountbyemployee" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">25,000</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;per year and subject to other plan limitations, toward the purchase of our common stock at a discounted price.  The purchase price of the shares on each purchase date is equal to&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e383-wk-Fact-FAD8282F0C455587A4FA902D400252ED" name="pmtc:ESPPpurchasepriceasaofstockprice" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">85</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;of the lower of the fair market value of our common stock on the first and last trading days of each offering period.  The ESPP is qualified under Section&#160;423 of the Internal Revenue Code.  We estimate the fair value of each purchase right under the ESPP on the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option valuation model and use the straight-line attribution approach to record the expense over the six-month offering period.&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;padding-left:48px;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><span Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The performance-based RSUs were granted to our executive officers and are eligible to vest based upon annual increasing performance measures over a </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic;font-size:10pt;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">-year period.  RSUs not earned for a period may be earned in the third period.  To the extent earned, those performance-based RSUs will vest in </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e801-wk-Fact-75B601BE74F654789D436422D6230808" name="pmtc:NumberOfEqualAnnualInstallments" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_AwardTypeAxis_us-gaap_PerformanceSharesMember" unitRef="installment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">three</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;substantially equal installments on November&#160;15, 2020, November 15, 2021 and November 15, 2022, or the date the Compensation Committee determines the extent to which the applicable performance criteria have been achieved for each performance period. </span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">(2)</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The service-based RSUs were granted to employees, including our executive officers.  Substantially all service-based RSUs will vest in </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e820-wk-Fact-B9DD78E30DBC5C2B97F10D2E957B0F4F" name="pmtc:NumberOfEqualAnnualInstallments" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_AwardTypeAxis_us-gaap_RestrictedStockMember" unitRef="installment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">three</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> substantially equal annual installments on or about the anniversary of the date of grant. </span></div></td></tr></table></ix:nonNumeric><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-E86C9A3B3F8851A3A652F8846D87D57D-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-E86C9A3B3F8851A3A652F8846D87D57D-2"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:0px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">(3)</span></div></ix:continuation></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-E86C9A3B3F8851A3A652F8846D87D57D-2"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The Total Shareholder Return (TSR) units were granted to our executive officers pursuant to the terms described below.</span></div></ix:continuation></td></tr></table></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">10</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-8F6F8B681B585683AA72A1BB17CC71DD-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-8F6F8B681B585683AA72A1BB17CC71DD-3"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In the first </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of 2020, we granted the target performance-based TSR units ("target RSUs") shown in the table above to our executive officers. These RSUs are eligible to vest based upon our total shareholder return relative to a peer group (the &#8220;TSR units&#8221;), measured annually over a three-year period.  The number of TSR units to vest over the three-year period will be determined based on the performance of PTC stock relative to the stock performance of an index of PTC peer companies established as of the grant date, as determined at the end of three measurement periods ending on September 30, 2020, 2021 and 2022, respectively.  The shares earned for each period will vest on November 15 following each measurement period, up to a maximum of two times the number of target RSUs (up to a maximum of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e866-wk-Fact-1AD25913F670E597B043BA1FE00C1025" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardEquityInstrumentsOtherThanOptionsGrantsInPeriod" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_AwardTypeAxis_pmtc_TSRUnitsMember_us-gaap_VestingAxis_pmtc_CatchUpProvisionMember" unitRef="shares" decimals="-3" scale="3" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">178</ix:nonFraction> thousand</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> shares).  No vesting will occur in a period unless an annual threshold requirement is achieved. If the return to PTC shareholders is negative but still meets or exceeds the peer group indexed return, a maximum of 100%&#160;of the target RSUs will vest for the measurement period.  TSR units not earned in either of the first two measurement periods are eligible to be earned in the third measurement period.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The weighted-average fair value of the TSR units was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88326614e873-wk-Fact-C1182C440088CC1E616CBA21FDF2163E" name="us-gaap:ShareBasedCompensationArrangementByShareBasedPaymentAwardEquityInstrumentsOtherThanOptionsGrantsInPeriodWeightedAverageGrantDateFairValue" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_AwardTypeAxis_pmtc_TSRUnitsMember" unitRef="usdPerShare" decimals="2" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">106.69</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> per target RSU on the grant date. The fair value of the TSR units was determined using a Monte Carlo simulation model, a generally accepted statistical technique used to simulate a range of possible future stock prices for PTC and the peer group. The method uses a risk-neutral framework to model future stock price movements based upon the risk-free rate of return, the volatility of each entity, and the pairwise correlations of each entity being modeled. The fair value for each simulation is the product of the payout percentage determined by PTC&#8217;s TSR rank against the peer group, the projected price of PTC stock, and a discount factor based on the risk-free rate. </span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfShareBasedPaymentAwardStockOptionsValuationAssumptionsTableTextBlock" id="TextSelection-883C87180E223BDE165ABA0158EE82DE-0-wk-Fact-8C9FA4D5112181B717C6BA0481B16AC4" escape="true"><div Monte Carlo simulation model were as follows:</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;padding-left:30px;font-size:10pt;"><div Common Stock</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-B3996E3D149F55569259411505B34D85-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">EPS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Basic EPS is calculated by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of shares outstanding during the period.  Diluted EPS is calculated by dividing net income by the weighted-average number of shares outstanding plus the dilutive effect, if any, of outstanding RSUs using the treasury stock method.  The calculation of the dilutive effect of outstanding equity awards under the treasury stock method includes consideration of unrecognized compensation expense as additional proceeds.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:ScheduleOfEarningsPerShareBasicAndDilutedTableTextBlock" costs in the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> three months of 2020 totaled </span><span format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> in the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> three months of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  Acquisition-related costs include direct costs of potential and completed acquisitions (e.g., investment banker fees and professional fees, including legal and valuation services) and expenses related to acquisition integration activities (e.g., professional fees and severance).  In addition, subsequent adjustments to our initial estimated amount of contingent consideration associated with specific acquisitions are included within acquisition-related charges.  These costs are classified in general and administrative expenses in the accompanying Consolidated Statements of Operations.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our results of operations include the results of acquired businesses beginning on their respective acquisition date.  Our results of operations for the reported periods if presented on a pro forma basis would not differ materially from our reported results.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Onshape</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">On November&#160;1, 2019, we completed our acquisition of Onshape Inc. pursuant to the Agreement and Plan of Merger dated as of October 23, 2019 by and among Onshape Inc., OPAL Acquisition Corporation and the Stockholder Representative named therein, the terms of which are described in the Form&#160;8-K filed by PTC on October&#160;23, 2019 and which is filed as Exhibit&#160;1.1 to that Form 8-K.  PTC paid approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e401-wk-Fact-8E82A5F78E96B7CEEB95CD74A6A1558D" name="us-gaap:BusinessCombinationConsiderationTransferred1" contextRef="D2020Q1Onshape_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_OnshapeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">468</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, net of cash acquired, for Onshape, which amount we borrowed under our existing credit facility.  Onshape is not expected to be material to our 2020 results.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The acquisition of Onshape has been accounted for as a business combination.  Assets acquired and liabilities assumed have been recorded at their estimated fair values as of the acquisition date.  The fair values of intangible assets were based on valuations using a discounted cash flow model which requires the use of significant estimates and assumptions, including estimating future revenues and costs.  The excess of the purchase price over the tangible assets, identifiable intangible assets and assumed liabilities was recorded as goodwill.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">12</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-45B52F2B0A3A52A6B45DE0FB9B249464-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The purchase price allocation is preliminary, pending finalization of the valuation and allocation of the acquired intangible assets, as well as related deferred tax liabilities. The acquired customer relationships, purchased software, and trademark are being amortized over useful lives of</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d88327310e432-wk-Fact-65FA308DA5DFF06021D1DDBD98CCE060" name="us-gaap:AcquiredFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsWeightedAverageUsefulLife" contextRef="D2020Q1Onshape_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_OnshapeMember_us-gaap_FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaap_CustomerListsMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">10</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d88327310e436-wk-Fact-D775589799C64A5A4F87CD84B0F3E675" name="us-gaap:AcquiredFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsWeightedAverageUsefulLife" contextRef="D2020Q1Onshape_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_OnshapeMember_us-gaap_FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaap_ComputerSoftwareIntangibleAssetMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">16</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d88327310e440-wk-Fact-B8F08EAFD0374D75DDACDDBDB1335073" name="us-gaap:AcquiredFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsWeightedAverageUsefulLife" contextRef="D2020Q1Onshape_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_OnshapeMember_us-gaap_FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaap_TrademarksMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">15</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, based on the expected benefit pattern of the assets.  The acquired goodwill was allocated to our software products segment and will not be deductible for income tax purposes.  The resulting amount of goodwill reflects the expected value that will be created by accelerating CAD and PLM growth, especially in the low-end of the market and participating in future growth in the CAD and PLM SaaS market.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Frustum</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">On November 19, 2018, we acquired Frustum Inc. for&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e450-wk-Fact-5754ECADE83E54A2AED1DD3C51AC773A" name="us-gaap:BusinessCombinationConsiderationTransferred1" contextRef="D2019Q1Frustum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">69.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> (net of cash acquired of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e454-wk-Fact-BB2D5A3907D15D8AB4C8531CB6F5D46E" name="us-gaap:CashAcquiredFromAcquisition" contextRef="D2019Q1Frustum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">). We financed the acquisition with borrowings under our credit facility.  Frustum is engaged in next-generation computer-aided design, including generative design, an approach that leverages artificial intelligence to generate design options. At the time of the acquisition, Frustum had approximately&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e458-wk-Fact-B53597BE74925E3EAE978EE0591DFB8C" name="dei:EntityNumberOfEmployees" contextRef="I2019Q1Furstum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember" unitRef="employee" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> employees and historical annualized revenues were not material. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The acquisition of Frustum was accounted for as a business combination.  Assets acquired and liabilities assumed were recorded at their estimated fair values as of the acquisition date.  The fair values of intangible assets were based on valuations using a discounted cash flow model which requires the use of significant estimates and assumptions, including estimating future revenues and costs.  The excess of the purchase price over the tangible assets, identifiable intangible assets and assumed liabilities was recorded as goodwill.&#160;</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The purchase price allocation resulted in </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e468-wk-Fact-90CE4AE556BD516EA39C77CBEC503EB7" name="us-gaap:GoodwillAcquiredDuringPeriod" contextRef="D2019Q1Frustum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">53.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of goodwill, </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e472-wk-Fact-02F6E420D3CA55B28324DE936D2FF7BB" name="us-gaap:FinitelivedIntangibleAssetsAcquired1" contextRef="D2019Q1Frustum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember_us-gaap_FiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsByMajorClassAxis_us-gaap_ComputerSoftwareIntangibleAssetMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">17.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of purchased software and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88327310e476-wk-Fact-E0F88839DEF35EFC9BBFE3085381B536" name="us-gaap:BusinessCombinationRecognizedIdentifiableAssetsAcquiredAndLiabilitiesAssumedNet" contextRef="I2019Q1Furstum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of other net liabilities.  The acquired technology is being amortized over a useful life of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d88327310e480-wk-Fact-2FCE58326E095D3797B222B9AC24829C" name="us-gaap:AcquiredFiniteLivedIntangibleAssetsWeightedAverageUsefulLife" contextRef="D2019Q1Frustum_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_pmtc_FrustumMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">15</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> based on the expected benefit pattern of the assets.  The acquired goodwill was allocated to our software products segment and will not be deductible for income tax purposes.  The resulting amount of goodwill reflects the expected value that will be created by integrating Frustum generative design technology into our CAD solutions.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><a id="s5729C9315EAC513E95C085019D0A9F83"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">7. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:GoodwillAndIntangibleAssetsDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-8771C651287F5EE7BE8DED210D4AA624-0-wk-Fact-653577FBFBE1588092BAA61BB0C27716" continuedAt="TextSelection-8771C651287F5EE7BE8DED210D4AA624-1" escape="true">Goodwill and Intangible Assets</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-8771C651287F5EE7BE8DED210D4AA624-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-8771C651287F5EE7BE8DED210D4AA624-2"><div style="line-height:120%;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We have </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88329516e365-wk-Fact-C0DF489B92375DC8B304BFB51A3F26A8" name="us-gaap:NumberOfOperatingSegments" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="Segment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> operating and reportable segments: (1)&#160;Software Products and (2) Professional Services.  We assess goodwill for impairment at the reporting unit level.  Our reporting units are determined based on the components of our operating segments that constitute a business for which discrete financial information is available and for which operating results are regularly reviewed by segment management.  Our reporting units are the same as our operating segments.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, goodwill and acquired intangible assets in the aggregate attributable to our Software Products segment was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88329516e376-wk-Fact-F66D848894C050DD9496A8F5A48782FD" name="us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsNetIncludingGoodwill" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_pmtc_SegmentSoftwareProductsMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,826.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and attributable to our Professional Services segment was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88329516e380-wk-Fact-7436257D9F8952158FF0799887E7D78E" name="us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsNetIncludingGoodwill" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_pmtc_ProfessionalServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">45.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, goodwill and acquired intangible assets in the aggregate attributable to our Software Products segment was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88329516e388-wk-Fact-308185F7535E58EABE2D9B91E689F433" name="us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsNetIncludingGoodwill" contextRef="FI2019Q4_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_pmtc_SegmentSoftwareProductsMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1,362.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and attributable to our Professional Services segment was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88329516e393-wk-Fact-069396982A93509A8AEA26D9A4C5218B" name="us-gaap:IntangibleAssetsNetIncludingGoodwill" contextRef="FI2019Q4_us-gaap_StatementBusinessSegmentsAxis_pmtc_ProfessionalServicesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">45.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  Acquired intangible assets are reviewed for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying value of the asset may not be recoverable.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We completed our annual goodwill impairment review as of&#160;June 29, 2019&#160;based on a qualitative assessment.  Our qualitative assessment included company specific (financial performance and long-range plans), industry, and macroeconomic factors, and consideration of the fair value of each reporting unit relative to its carrying value at the last valuation date.  Based on our qualitative assessment, we believe it is more likely than not that the fair values of our reporting units exceed their carrying values and no further impairment testing is required. </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">13</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-8771C651287F5EE7BE8DED210D4AA624-2"><ix:nonNumeric #000000;"><div style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88329516e2382-wk-Fact-2E1660EF34F255F09B557704F71AC494" name="us-gaap:AmortizationOfIntangibleAssets" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="3" Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><a id="s4467AC63BF7D565E9AA13FBD0BDF2E78"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">8. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:FairValueDisclosuresTextBlock" id="TextSelection-BCF1EE52CFF95AB5B1908D1D4DD6BF91-0-wk-Fact-4894E03AC4365B03A9EA14ED97F02E4A" continuedAt="TextSelection-BCF1EE52CFF95AB5B1908D1D4DD6BF91-1" escape="true">Fair Value Measurements</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-BCF1EE52CFF95AB5B1908D1D4DD6BF91-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-BCF1EE52CFF95AB5B1908D1D4DD6BF91-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Fair value is defined as the price that would be received from selling an asset or paid to transfer a liability in an orderly transaction between market participants at the measurement date. When determining the fair value measurements for assets and liabilities required to be recorded at fair value, we consider the principal or most advantageous market in which we would transact and consider assumptions that market participants would use when pricing the asset or liability, such as inherent risk, transfer restrictions, and risk of nonperformance.  GAAP prescribes a fair value hierarchy that requires an entity to maximize the use of observable inputs and minimize the use of unobservable inputs when measuring fair value.  A financial instrument&#8217;s categorization within the fair value hierarchy is based upon the lowest level of input that is significant to the fair value measurement. Three levels of inputs that may be used to measure fair value:</span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Level 1: quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities;</span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Level 2: inputs other than Level 1 that are observable, either directly or indirectly, such as quoted prices in active markets for similar assets or liabilities, quoted prices for identical or similar assets or liabilities in markets that are not active, or other inputs that are observable or can be corroborated by observable market data for substantially the full term of the assets or liabilities; or</span></div></td></tr></table></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">14</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-BCF1EE52CFF95AB5B1908D1D4DD6BF91-2"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;padding-left:48px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#8226;</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Level 3: unobservable inputs that are supported by little or no market activity and that are significant to the fair value of the assets or liabilities.</span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">A financial instrument&#8217;s level within the fair value hierarchy is based on the lowest level of any input that is significant to the fair value measurement.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Money market funds, time deposits and corporate notes/bonds are classified within Level 1 of the fair value hierarchy because they are valued based on quoted market prices in active markets. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Certificates of deposit, commercial paper and certain U.S. government agency securities are classified within Level 2 of the fair value hierarchy.  These instruments are valued based on quoted prices in markets that are not active or based on other observable inputs consisting of market yields, reported trades and broker/dealer quotes. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The principal market in which we execute our foreign currency contracts is the institutional market in an over-the-counter environment with a relatively high level of price transparency.  The market participants usually are large financial institutions.  Our foreign currency contracts&#8217; valuation inputs are based on quoted prices and quoted pricing intervals from public data sources and do not involve management judgment.  These contracts are typically classified within Level 2 of the fair value hierarchy. </span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:FairValueByBalanceSheetGroupingTextBlock" id="TextSelection-BEAD6C479D7F5ECB8DED29532F219B2A-0-wk-Fact-FF19C02FA47151F78D0D8FCAA9039562" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our significant financial assets and liabilities measured at fair value on a recurring basis as of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Non-Marketable Equity Investments</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We account for non-marketable equity investments at cost, less any impairment, plus or minus adjustments resulting from observable price changes in orderly transactions for identical or similar investments of the same issuer.  We monitor non-marketable equity investments for events that could indicate that the investments are impaired, such as deterioration in the investee's financial condition and business forecasts, and lower valuations in recent or proposed financings.  Changes in fair value of non-marketable equity investments are recorded in Other income (expense), net on the Consolidated Statements of Operations.  The carrying value of our non-marketable equity investments is recorded in other assets on the Consolidated Balance Sheets and totaled </span><span style="font-family:Century </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">two</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> years. style="text-align:right;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88334099e2513-wk-Fact-6DC04D03BEE5597B80534C2C098F88EA" style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td></tr></table></div><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><a id="sF8C823D0899956AAA219015F868C4A4D"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">10. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:DerivativeInstrumentsAndHedgingActivitiesDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-0-wk-Fact-0ED363BA062150918E37C6BFB694D6B4" continuedAt="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-1" escape="true">Derivative Financial Instruments</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our earnings and cash flows are subject to fluctuations due to changes in foreign currency exchange rates.  Our most significant foreign currency exposures relate to Western European countries, Japan, China, Israel, India and Canada.  Our foreign currency risk management strategy is principally designed to mitigate the future potential financial impact of changes in the U.S. Dollar value of </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">16</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-3"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">anticipated transactions and balances denominated in foreign currency resulting from changes in foreign currency exchange rates. We enter into derivative transactions, specifically foreign currency forward contracts, to manage the exposures to foreign currency exchange risk to reduce earnings volatility.  We do not enter into derivatives transactions for trading or speculative purposes.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;padding-left:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Non-Designated Hedges</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We hedge our net foreign currency monetary assets and liabilities primarily resulting from foreign currency denominated receivables and payables with foreign exchange forward contracts to reduce the risk that our earnings and cash flows will be adversely affected by changes in foreign currency exchange rates.  These contracts have maturities of up to approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d88337369e374-wk-Fact-BB7C7A4397D3513FA193D7E37A5091FC" name="us-gaap:DerivativeRemainingMaturity1" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaap_ForeignExchangeForwardMember_us-gaap_HedgingDesignationAxis_us-gaap_NondesignatedMember" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">seven months</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  Generally, we do not designate these foreign currency forward contracts as hedges for accounting purposes and changes in the fair value of these instruments are recognized immediately in earnings.  Because we enter into forward contracts only as an economic hedge, any gain or loss on the underlying foreign-denominated balance would be offset by the loss or gain on the forward contract.  Gains and losses on forward contracts and foreign denominated receivables and payables are included in Other income (expense), net.</span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-82980D5648115724B4BA67673FE685C0-0"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, we had outstanding forward contracts with notional amounts equivalent to the following:</span></div><div
