Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> there were </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88337369e1262-wk-Fact-AAE49774DAA75874BCC99E828FB38AA6" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnForeignCurrencyDerivativeInstrumentsNotDesignatedAsHedgingInstruments" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> gains or losses on foreign currency.  In the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;29, 2018</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> foreign currency losses, net were </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88337369e1278-wk-Fact-336872FD3D7E5BC5B7382A13074FC54D" name="us-gaap:GainLossOnForeignCurrencyDerivativeInstrumentsNotDesignatedAsHedgingInstruments" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.2</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;padding-left:20px;text-indent:12px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Net Investment Hedges</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We translate balance sheet accounts of subsidiaries with foreign functional currencies into the U.S. Dollar using the exchange rate at each balance sheet date.  Resulting translation adjustments are reported as a component of accumulated other comprehensive loss on the Consolidated Balance Sheet.  We designate certain foreign exchange forward contracts as net investment hedges against exposure on translation of balance sheet accounts of Euro functional subsidiaries.  Net investment hedges </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">17</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-3" continuedAt="TextSelection-EF7D582682FF5AE0BD32D4FE94F370F2-4"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">partially offset the impact of foreign currency translation adjustment recorded in accumulated other comprehensive loss on the Consolidated Balance Sheet.  All foreign exchange forward contracts are carried at fair value on the Consolidated Balance Sheet and the maximum duration of foreign exchange forward contracts is approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d88337369e1313-wk-Fact-91B3951A71735E03B1DBEDAFF78B37F4" name="us-gaap:DerivativeRemainingMaturity1" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_DerivativeInstrumentRiskAxis_us-gaap_ForeignExchangeForwardMember_us-gaap_DerivativeInstrumentsGainLossByHedgingRelationshipAxis_us-gaap_NetInvestmentHedgingMember_us-gaap_HedgingDesignationAxis_us-gaap_DesignatedAsHedgingInstrumentMember" format="ixt-sec:durwordsen">three months</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Net investment hedge relationships are designated at inception, and effectiveness is assessed retrospectively on a quarterly basis using the net equity position of Euro functional subsidiaries.  As the forward contracts are highly effective in offsetting exchange rate exposure, we record changes in these net investment hedges in accumulated other comprehensive loss and subsequently reclassify them to foreign currency translation adjustment in accumulated other comprehensive loss at the time of forward contract maturity.  Changes in the fair value of foreign exchange forward contracts due to changes in time value are excluded from the assessment of effectiveness.  Our derivatives are not subject to any credit contingent features.  We manage credit risk with counterparties by trading among several counterparties and we review our counterparties&#8217; credit at least quarterly.</span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" other current liabilities in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.  </span></div></ix:continuation></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span allow net settlements under certain conditions. contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:SegmentReportingDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-06CCE0D5642356B38A8A81160CBC6E32-0-wk-Fact-022D7927091759F298EC8CFC9F7C4348" continuedAt="TextSelection-06CCE0D5642356B38A8A81160CBC6E32-1" escape="true">Segment and Geographic Information </ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-06CCE0D5642356B38A8A81160CBC6E32-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-06CCE0D5642356B38A8A81160CBC6E32-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We operate within a single industry segment -- computer software and related services.  Operating segments as defined under GAAP are components of an enterprise about which separate financial information is available that is evaluated regularly by the chief operating decision maker, or decision-making group, in deciding how to allocate resources and in assessing performance.  Our chief operating decision maker is our President and Chief Executive Officer.  We have </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339074e365-wk-Fact-C0DF489B92375DC8B304BFB51A3F26A8" name="us-gaap:NumberOfOperatingSegments" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="Segment" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> operating and&#160;reportable segments: (1)&#160;Software Products, which includes license, subscription and related support revenue (including updates and technical support) for all our products; and (2) Professional Services, which includes consulting, implementation and training services.  We do not allocate sales and marketing or general and administrative expense to our operating segments as these activities are managed on a consolidated basis.  Additionally, segment profit does not include stock-based compensation, amortization of intangible assets, restructuring charges and certain other identified costs that we do not allocate to the segments for purposes of evaluating their operational performance.  </span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-DB561D236C75568AA6A0081385EED5C0-0" continuedAt="TextSelection-DB561D236C75568AA6A0081385EED5C0-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The revenue and profit attributable to our operating segments are summarized below. We do not produce asset information by reportable segment; therefore, it is not reported.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:continuation></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div Taxes</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-7C36B9F38D2155E6828A647748154538-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In the </span><span Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>(<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e374-wk-Fact-DA72258DCCE75893B109930D389A6CEB" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">86</ix:nonFraction>)%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> on pre-tax income of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e378-wk-Fact-729A6D4F988D58C39E6FDAD0D52285E9" name="us-gaap:IncomeLossFromContinuingOperationsBeforeIncomeTaxesExtraordinaryItemsNoncontrollingInterest" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">19.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, compared to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>(<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e382-wk-Fact-C92FC2B1A93A5BEABDBFFFB9DD934826" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateContinuingOperations" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3</ix:nonFraction>)%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> on pre-tax income of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e387-wk-Fact-545C46BDEFB6575ABB501128F442811B" name="us-gaap:IncomeLossFromContinuingOperationsBeforeIncomeTaxesExtraordinaryItemsNoncontrollingInterest" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">20.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, respectively.  In the first </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, our effective tax rate differed from the statutory federal income tax rate of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e419-wk-Fact-ADBE25F882FB58CAA01624A474F3C6A3" name="us-gaap:EffectiveIncomeTaxRateReconciliationAtFederalStatutoryIncomeTaxRate" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">21</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> due to U.S. tax reform, our corporate structure in which our foreign taxes are at a net effective tax rate lower than the U.S. rate, the excess tax benefit related to stock-based compensation and the indirect effects of the adoption of ASC 606.  Additionally, in the first </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and 2019, we reduced the valuation allowance by </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e432-wk-Fact-1A0105E9F9895ED1B897A7B914C2757F" name="us-gaap:ValuationAllowanceDeferredTaxAssetChangeInAmount" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">21.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e437-wk-Fact-23F1EC6B6737E8F79593CD717D41F9E0" name="us-gaap:ValuationAllowanceDeferredTaxAssetChangeInAmount" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" sign="-" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> as the result of the Onshape and Frustum acquisitions, respectively.  A significant amount of our foreign earnings is generated by our subsidiaries organized in Ireland.  In </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, the foreign rate differential predominantly relates to these Irish earnings.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We have concluded, based on the weight of available evidence, that a full valuation allowance continues to be required against our U.S. net deferred tax assets as they are not more likely than not to be realized in the future.  We will continue to reassess our valuation allowance requirements each financial reporting period.  However, we believe that there is a reasonable possibility that within the next 12 months, sufficient positive evidence may become available to allow us to reach a conclusion that a significant portion of the valuation allowance will no longer be needed. Release of the valuation allowance would result in the recognition of certain deferred tax assets and a decrease to income tax expense for the period the release is recorded.  However, the exact timing and amount of any valuation allowance release are subject to change on the basis of the level of profitability that we are able to actually achieve.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In the normal course of business, PTC and its subsidiaries are examined by various taxing authorities, including the Internal Revenue Service in the U.S.  We regularly assess the likelihood of additional assessments by tax authorities and provide for these matters as appropriate.  We are currently under audit by tax authorities in several jurisdictions.  Audits by tax authorities typically involve examination of the deductibility of certain permanent items, limitations on net operating losses and tax credits.  Although we believe our tax estimates are appropriate, the final determination of tax audits and any related litigation could result in material changes in our estimates.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">September&#160;30, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, we had unrecognized tax benefits of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e466-wk-Fact-5F747ACB669A501F895F2F5BF0DB5F38" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefits" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e470-wk-Fact-71E5A7D2C9FF5DA9B7DC6F279EFB72E1" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefits" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">11.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, respectively.  If all our unrecognized tax benefits as of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> were to become recognizable in the future, we would record a benefit to the income tax provision of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e479-wk-Fact-675A1C70DFF6569FAC02C3A2CFB1E1B2" name="us-gaap:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsThatWouldImpactEffectiveTaxRate" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, which would be partially offset by an increase in the U.S. valuation allowance of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e483-wk-Fact-73D39096F0A15DD2B0190E0AD79734FC" name="pmtc:UnrecognizedTaxBenefitsThatWouldImpactEffectiveTaxRateResultingChangeInValuationAllowance" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">6.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.&#160; </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Although we believe our tax estimates are appropriate, the final determination of tax audits and any related litigation could result in favorable or unfavorable changes in our estimates.  We believe it is reasonably possible that within the next 12 months the amount of unrecognized tax benefits related to the resolution of multi-jurisdictional tax positions could be reduced by up to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e490-wk-Fact-0EDD4A530EE35B24A03EE7C213767FEC" name="us-gaap:SignificantChangeInUnrecognizedTaxBenefitsIsReasonablyPossibleAmountOfUnrecordedBenefit" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> as audits close and statutes of limitations expire. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In the fourth quarter of 2016, we received an assessment of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e497-wk-Fact-4F99994AD78658F4BC4DE18AE4523CF3" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExaminationEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="D2016Q4July_us-gaap_IncomeTaxAuthorityAxis_pmtc_KoreaMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">12</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> from the tax authorities in South Korea.&#160; The assessment relates to various tax issues, primarily foreign withholding taxes. We have appealed and intend to vigorously defend our positions.  We believe that upon completion of a multi-level appeal process it is more likely than not that our positions will be sustained.&#160; Accordingly, we have not recorded a tax reserve for this matter.  We paid this assessment in the first quarter of 2017 and have recorded the amount in other assets, pending resolution of the appeal process.  If the South Korean tax authorities were to prevail the potential additional exposure through 2019 would be approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339136e507-wk-Fact-E7019A03BF57094C5195CDC9BBFB9BF4" name="us-gaap:IncomeTaxExaminationEstimateOfPossibleLoss" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_StatementScenarioAxis_pmtc_AdditionalExposureMember_us-gaap_IncomeTaxAuthorityAxis_country_KR" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">13</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  We are continuing to work with our advisors during the court process and still believe our position is sustainable.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">21</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> as of December&#160;28, 2019 and September 30, 2019, respectively, and were included in other assets in the Consolidated Balance Sheets.</span></div></ix:continuation></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Senior Notes</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In May 2016, we issued&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e661-wk-Fact-C8C516B23FC352E78FB5332AAA80D210" name="us-gaap:SeniorNotes" contextRef="I2016Q3SDMay" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">500</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in aggregate principal amount of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e665-wk-Fact-26B8BC126931559BB8270736C132DB83" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateStatedPercentage" contextRef="I2016Q3SDMay_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_SeniorNotesMember" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">6.0</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;senior, unsecured long-term debt at par value, due in&#160;2024.  We used the net proceeds from the sale of the notes to repay a portion of our outstanding revolving loan under our current credit facility.  Interest is payable&#160;semi-annually&#160;on November&#160;15 and May&#160;15.  The debt indenture includes covenants that limit our ability to, among other things, incur additional debt, grant liens on our properties or capital stock, enter into sale and leaseback transactions or asset sales, and make capital distributions.  We were in compliance with all the covenants as of&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">On and after May 15, 2019, we may redeem the senior notes at any time in whole or from time to time in part at specified redemption prices. In certain circumstances constituting a change of control, we will be required to make an offer to repurchase the senior notes at a purchase price equal to&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e676-wk-Fact-969B036BD6BD58BB8B2F7C8800EB1D8D" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentRedemptionPricePercentage" contextRef="D2019Q3SD_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_SeniorNotesMember" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">101</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;of the aggregate principal amount of the notes, plus accrued and unpaid interest.  Our ability to repurchase the senior notes in such event may be limited by law, by the indenture associated with the senior notes, by our then-available financial resources or by the terms of other agreements to which we may be party at such time.  If we fail to repurchase the senior notes as required by the indenture, it would constitute an event of default under the indenture which, in turn, may also constitute an event of default under other obligations.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, the total estimated fair value of the senior notes was approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e687-wk-Fact-EFD04A369887529B996E1CAD66C00642" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentFairValue" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_LongtermDebtTypeAxis_us-gaap_SeniorNotesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">522.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, based on quoted prices for the notes on that date.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Credit Agreement</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We maintain a multi-currency credit facility with a syndicate of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e697-wk-Fact-F00AF92467C45594887B9A0A95C85611" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">sixteen</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> banks for which JPMorgan Chase Bank, N.A. acts as Administrative Agent.  We use the credit facility for general corporate purposes, including acquisitions of businesses, share repurchases and working capital requirements. As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, the fair value of our credit facility approximates its book value.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In November 2019, we amended the credit facility to increase the revolving loan commitment from </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e708-wk-Fact-1BC36044376D5FA19986339DC98F5AB6" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="I2018Q4_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">700</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e712-wk-Fact-8DA9411CF0C650FDB58A0F067BF7351F" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="I2020Q1Debtamendment_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="INF" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  The revolving loan commitment does not require amortization of principal and may be repaid in whole or in part prior to the scheduled maturity date at our option without penalty or premium.  The credit facility matures on September 13, 2023, when all remaining amounts outstanding will be due and payable in full.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">PTC Inc. and certain eligible foreign subsidiaries are eligible to borrow under the credit facility.  Any borrowings by PTC Inc. under the credit facility would be guaranteed by PTC Inc.&#8217;s material domestic subsidiaries that become parties to the subsidiary guaranty, if any.  As of the filing of this Form 10-Q, there are no subsidiary guarantors of the obligations under the credit facility.  Any borrowings by eligible foreign subsidiary borrowers would be guaranteed by PTC Inc. and any subsidiary guarantors.  As of the filing of this Form 10-Q there were </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e720-wk-Fact-DD98BEA126985EC48F2F8FDC431C3A8B" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="I2020Q2_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_LineOfCreditMember_us-gaap_SubordinatedBorrowingAxis_pmtc_ForeignSubsidiaryMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">no</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> borrowings by eligible foreign subsidiaries.  In addition, substantially all existing and after-acquired personal property of PTC Inc. and certain of its material domestic subsidiaries that become parties to the subsidiary guaranty, if any, is or will be, in the case of such subsidiary guarantors, subject to first priority perfected liens in favor of the lenders under the credit facility. </span><span style="font-family:Century ratio.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The credit facility limits into joint ventures; dispose of assets; and engage in transactions with affiliates, except on an arms-length basis. Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, our total leverage ratio was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e848-wk-Fact-38D15B3C15A15DD8B019B7708E2FB81F" name="pmtc:LeverageRatioActual" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="INF" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.63</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.00</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, our senior secured leverage ratio was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e856-wk-Fact-01CE7F4C29E05254B69B3079D2E7EB9D" name="pmtc:DebtInstrumentCovenantComplianceSeniorDebtLeverageRatioactual" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.04</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.00</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and our interest coverage ratio was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e865-wk-Fact-4F17AC3CB89D59299F1EAC2453952DBC" name="pmtc:InterestCoverageRatioActual" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">7.69</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">1.00</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and we were in compliance with all financial and operating covenants of the credit facility. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Any failure to comply with the financial or operating covenants of the credit facility would prevent PTC from being able to borrow additional funds, and would constitute a default, permitting the lenders to, among other things, accelerate the amounts outstanding, including all accrued interest and unpaid fees, under the credit facility and to terminate the credit facility.  A change in control of PTC, as defined in the agreement, also constitutes an event of default, permitting the lenders to accelerate the indebtedness and terminate the credit facility.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We incurred&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e879-wk-Fact-6E7AD628E92F54B38E5AFA6B8500175C" name="us-gaap:PaymentsOfDebtIssuanceCosts" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">&#160;in financing costs in connection with the November 2019 credit facility amendment.  These origination costs are recorded as deferred debt issuance costs and are included in other assets.  Financing costs are expensed over the remaining term of the obligations.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:4px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> quarter of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> we paid </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e899-wk-Fact-51E9448C8FAB5E409081ADE337DDEE10" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentInterest" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">16.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e903-wk-Fact-14ECCBBD39215FA5B187615375038F42" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentPeriodicPaymentInterest" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">16.7</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> of interest on our debt, respectively.  The average interest rate on borrowings outstanding during&#160;the </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">first</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> quarter of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and was approximately&#160;</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e921-wk-Fact-2907FAA556FF56208484955312681454" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateDuringPeriod" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">4.9</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88339612e925-wk-Fact-5FB065ADD32D550DA19648145ABA3171" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateDuringPeriod" contextRef="FD2019Q1QTD" unitRef="number" decimals="3" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">5.4</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, respectively.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><a id="s67fc86c43af742df9225fd8be94a04e3"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">14. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:LesseeOperatingLeasesTextBlock" id="TextSelection-AD11AC75D4D00591E9CCA1B1D9C86E09-0-wk-Fact-CFF629ED73A93D65BF79A1B4F8144BBE" continuedAt="TextSelection-AD11AC75D4D00591E9CCA1B1D9C86E09-1" escape="true">Leases</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-AD11AC75D4D00591E9CCA1B1D9C86E09-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-AD11AC75D4D00591E9CCA1B1D9C86E09-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We determine if an arrangement is a lease at inception.  Operating leases are included in operating lease right-of-use assets and operating lease obligations on our Consolidated Balance Sheets.  Our operating leases are primarily for office space, cars, servers, and office equipment.  Finance leases are included in property and equipment, accrued expenses and other current liabilities, and other liabilities on our Consolidated Balance Sheets.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> Right-of-use assets represent our right to use an underlying asset for the lease term and lease liabilities represent our obligation to make lease payments arising from the leases.  Right-of-use assets and liabilities are recognized at commencement date based on the present value of lease payments over the lease term.  As most of our leases do not provide an implicit rate, we generally use our incremental borrowing rate based on the estimated rate of interest for collateralized borrowing over a similar term of the lease payments at commencement date.  The right-of-use assets include any lease payments made and exclude lease incentives received.  Lease expense for lease payments is recognized on a straight-line basis over the lease term.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">23</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-AD11AC75D4D00591E9CCA1B1D9C86E09-2" continuedAt="TextSelection-AD11AC75D4D00591E9CCA1B1D9C86E09-3"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our operating leases expire at various dates through&#160;2037.  Our lease terms may include options to extend or terminate the lease when it is reasonably certain that we will exercise that option. Certain office space leases require us to pay for taxes, insurance, maintenance and other operating expenses in addition to rent.&#160; </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our headquarters are located at 121 Seaport Boulevard, Boston, Massachusetts (the Boston lease).  The Boston lease is for approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e365-wk-Fact-1859D9F23C7488DDA585BEA634011233" name="pmtc:BostonLeaseSquareFeet" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="sqft" decimals="-3" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">250,000</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> square feet and runs from January 1, 2019 through June 30, 2037.  Base rent for the first year of the lease is </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e369-wk-Fact-CCE26D19EBA3766BBF74BEA70DF98486" name="pmtc:Bostonleaseyearonepayments" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">11.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and will increase by </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e373-wk-Fact-02F3ED6B78A5F77F69D3BEA7B581189E" name="pmtc:Bostonleasepersquarefootannualincrease" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> per square foot per year thereafter (</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e377-wk-Fact-166C076AE01EC471D0DCBEA85CC0174F" name="pmtc:Bostonleaseannualincrease" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> per year) with base rent first becoming payable on July 1, 2020.  In addition to the base rent, PTC is required to pay its pro rata portions of building operating costs and real estate taxes (together, &#8220;Additional Rent&#8221;).  Additional Rent is estimated to be approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e381-wk-Fact-C231AFF9CD448FB30FC3BEA95BAC4ED5" name="pmtc:Bostonleasebuildingoperatingcostamountestimateyearone" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">7.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> for the first year we begin paying rent.  The lease provides for </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e386-wk-Fact-410B75B8712307AF359CBEAA3302A753" name="pmtc:Bostonleaseleaseholdimprovementallowance" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">25</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> in landlord funding for leasehold improvements (</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340613e390-wk-Fact-4941CECADC3D4A20EF8ABEAB2FF357CE" name="pmtc:Bostonleaseleaseholdimprovementallowancepersquarefoot" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">100</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> per square foot).  Leasehold improvement funding provision was fully utilized by us and was reflected as a derecognition adjustment to the right-of-use asset.</span></div><ix:continuation assessment of approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340722e371-wk-Fact-4F99994AD78658F4BC4DE18AE4523CF3" Income Taxes</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> for additional information.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Legal Proceedings</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We are subject to various other legal proceedings and claims that arise in the ordinary course of business.  We do not believe that resolving the legal proceedings and claims that we are currently subject to will have a material adverse impact on our financial condition, results of operations or cash flows. However, the results of legal proceedings cannot be predicted with certainty.  Should any of these legal proceedings and claims be resolved against us, the operating results for a reporting period could be adversely affected.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Accruals</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">With respect to legal proceedings and claims, we record an accrual for a contingency when it is probable that a liability has been incurred and the amount of the loss can be reasonably estimated.  For legal proceedings and claims for which the likelihood that a liability has been incurred is more than remote but less than probable, we estimate the range of possible outcomes.  As of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">December&#160;28, 2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, we estimate approximately </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340722e395-wk-Fact-52B26747750B5BE89B9269AB3E1AC9AC" Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340722e399-wk-Fact-83929B55F54153219397C008E6138C39" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyEstimateOfPossibleLoss" million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> in legal proceedings and claims, of which we had accrued </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d88340722e403-wk-Fact-6049814773015433BBC24D8598A47AB1" name="us-gaap:LossContingencyAccrualAtCarryingValue" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_LitigationStatusAxis_us-gaap_PendingLitigationMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Guarantees and Indemnification Obligations</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We enter into standard indemnification agreements in the ordinary course of our business.  Under such agreements with our business partners or customers, we indemnify, hold harmless, and agree to reimburse the indemnified party for losses suffered or incurred by the indemnified party, generally in connection with patent, copyright or other intellectual property infringement claims by any third party with respect to our products, claims relating to property damage or personal injury resulting from the performance of services by us or our subcontractors and data breaches.  The maximum potential amount of future payments we could be required to make under indemnification agreements for intellectual property and damage and injury claims is unlimited; the maximum potential amount for indemnification for data breaches is capped in those contracts.  Historically, our costs to defend lawsuits or settle claims relating to such indemnity agreements have been minimal and, accordingly, we believe the estimated fair value of liabilities under these agreements is immaterial.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We warrant that our software products will perform in all material respects in accordance with our standard published specifications in effect at the time of delivery of the licensed products for a specified period of time.  Additionally, we generally warrant that our consulting services will be performed consistent with generally accepted industry standards.  In most cases, liability for these warranties is capped.  If necessary, we would provide for the estimated cost of product and service warranties based on specific warranty claims and claim history; however, we have not incurred significant cost under our </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">25</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-19370D220C16518F8DC64660538352D7-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">product or services warranties.  As a result, we believe the estimated fair value of these liabilities is immaterial.</span></div></ix:continuation><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><a id="sFB4F1D30FC705710A7BE2AC28B2D0F52"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 2. &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;MANAGEMENT&#8217;S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF OPERATIONS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:12px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Business Overview</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:29px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">PTC is a global software and services company that delivers solutions to power our industrial customers' digital transformations, helping them to better design, manufacture, operate, and service their products.  Our Internet of Things (IoT) and Augmented Reality (AR) solutions enable companies to connect factories and plants, smart products, and enterprise systems to transform their businesses.  These products, along with Onshape, are considered our </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Growth Products</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  The primary products in our </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Core Products</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> portfolio are innovative Computer-Aided Design (CAD) and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) solutions that enable manufacturers to create, innovate, and service products. Our </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Focused Solutions Group (FSG)</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> is a family of software products that target specific vertical industries where we can deliver unique domain expertise and a competitive advantage with Application Lifecycle Management (ALM) products, Service Lifecycle Management (SLM) products, and other niche tailored solutions.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Forward-Looking Statements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;padding-left:2px;text-indent:36px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Statements in this Quarterly Report on Form 10-Q that are not historic facts, including statements about our future financial and growth expectations and targets, are forward-looking statements that involve risks and uncertainties that could cause actual results to differ materially from those projected. These risks include: the macroeconomic and/or global manufacturing climates may deteriorate due to, among other factors, the geopolitical environment, including the U.S. Administration's focus on technology transactions with non-U.S. entities and potential expanded prohibitions, and ongoing trade tensions and tariffs; customers may not purchase our solutions or convert existing support contracts to subscription when or at the rates we expect; our Internet of Things (IoT), Augmented Reality and Onshape businesses may not expand and/or generate the revenue we expect; if customers are slower to adopt these technologies than we expect or adopt competing technologies, which would adversely affect our ARR, revenue and cash flows; customers may not renew subscription or support contracts with us as we expect if they elect to switch to competing technologies or otherwise cease using our software, which would adversely affect our ARR, revenue and cash flows; foreign currency exchange rates may vary from our expectations and thereby affect our reported revenue and expense; the mix of revenue between license and subscription solutions, support and professional services could be different than we expect, which could impact our EPS results; license purchases associated with minimum ACV commitments under our Strategic Alliance Agreement with Rockwell Automation may not result in subscription contracts sold through to end-user customers; our strategic initiatives and investments may not generate the revenue we expect; we may be unable to expand our partner ecosystem as we expect and our partners may not generate the revenue we expect; and technologies we acquire may not provide the access to new customers and markets that we expect if those customers and markets are not receptive to the technology; we may be unable to integrate the acquired technologies or entities when or as we expect, which could adversely affect our ability to offer additional products or solutions; customers may not adopt acquired technologies as we expect, which would adversely affect our revenue.  In addition, our assumptions concerning our future GAAP and non-GAAP effective income tax rates are based on estimates and other factors that could change, including the geographic mix of our revenue, expenses and profits, as well as other risks and uncertainties described below throughout or referenced in Part II, Item 1 A. Risk Factors of this report.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Operating and Non-GAAP Financial Measures</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our discussion of results includes discussion of our ARR operating measure and non-GAAP financial measures.  ARR and non-GAAP financial measures, including the reasons we use those measures, are described below in </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Results of Operations - Operating Measure</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Results of Operations - Non-GAAP Financial Measures, </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">respectively.  You should read those sections to understand those operating and non-GAAP financial measures.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Executive Overview</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Revenue was up 6% year over year (8% constant currency), despite a 78% decrease year over year in perpetual software revenue due to last time purchases of perpetual licenses in the first quarter of 2019, </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">26</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">at the end of which we ceased substantially all perpetual license sales.  Operating margin for the quarter was flat year over year despite $7.1 million of acquisition-related charges and increased intangible asset amortization expense associated with our acquisition of Onshape, a SaaS CAD and data management platform.  Non-GAAP operating margin of 26% increased 200 basis points over the fourth quarter of 2019 and declined 100 basis points compared to the prior year period due to the significant amount of perpetual license revenue in the first quarter of 2019.  EPS was up year over year, primarily due to a $21 million tax benefit related to the reversal of the U.S. valuation allowance associated with the acquisition of Onshape, and lower share count due to share buybacks in 2019.  Non-GAAP EPS was up 2% year over year.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We generated $8 million of cash from operations in the first three months of 2020 compared to $21 million in the first three months of 2019.  Cash from operations for the first three months of 2020 includes $3 million of restructuring payments and $6 million of acquisition-related payments compared to $8 million of restructuring payments in the prior year period.  In the first quarter of 2020, we amended our credit facility to increase the revolving loan commitment from </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$700 million</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1 billion</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> (which may be increased by up to an additional $500 million in the aggregate if the existing or additional lenders are willing to make such increased commitments).  As of December 28, 2019, the balance outstanding under our credit facility was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$628 million</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and total debt outstanding was </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$1,128 million</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">ARR was $1,158 million as of the end of the first quarter of 2020.  This represents 11% growth (11% constant currency) compared to the end of the first quarter of 2019, reflecting solid performance in our Growth and Core Product groups and in our global channel.  ARR growth in our Growth Products was up 35% year over year (36% constant currency).  ARR for our Core Products was up 9% year over year (10% constant currency).  ARR in FSG was up 1% year over year (1% constant currency).   </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We acquired Onshape on November 1, 2019 for $468 million, net of cash acquired.  The acquisition is expected to accelerate our ability to attract new customers with a SaaS-based product offering and position the company to capitalize on an industry transition to SaaS.  In connection with the acquisition, we borrowed $455 million under our credit facility.  Onshape is not expected to be material to our 2020 results.</span></div><div><a id="sB9D8CAEF58DC51F691E90112BFCE5A84"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">Results of Operations</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The following table shows the financial measures that we consider the most significant indicators of our business performance.  In addition to providing operating income, operating margin, diluted earnings per share and cash from operations as calculated under GAAP, we provide non-GAAP operating income, non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP diluted earnings per share and adjusted free cash flow for the reported periods.  These non-GAAP financial measures exclude the items described in </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Non-GAAP Financial Measures</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> below.  Investors should use these non-GAAP financial measures only in conjunction with our GAAP results. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:0px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">(2)</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">We have recorded a full valuation allowance against our U.S. net deferred tax assets. As we are profitable on a non-GAAP basis, the 2020 and 2019 non-GAAP tax provisions are calculated assuming there is no valuation allowance.  Income tax adjustments reflect the tax effects of non-GAAP adjustments, which are calculated by applying the applicable tax rate by jurisdiction to the non-GAAP adjustments listed above. </span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:8pt;padding-left:0px;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">(3)</span></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:8pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;">Cash flow from operations for the first three months of 2020 includes $3.3 million of restructuring payments and $6.4 million of acquisition-related payments.  Cash flow from operations for the first three months of 2019 includes $8.3 million of restructuring payments.</span></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Impact of Foreign Currency Exchange on Results of Operations</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Approximately 60% of our revenue and 40% of our expenses are transacted in currencies other than the U.S. Dollar.  Because we report our results of operations in U.S. Dollars, currency translation, particularly changes in the Euro, Yen, Sheqel, and Rupee relative to the U.S.&#160;Dollar, affects our reported results. Starting in the first quarter of 2020, our constant currency disclosures are calculated by multiplying the results in local currency for the first three months of 2020 and 2019 by the exchange rates in effect on September 30, 2019, excluding the effect of any hedging.  The results of operations in the table above and revenue by line of business, product group, and geographic region in the tables that follow present both actual percentage changes year over year and percentage changes on a constant currency basis.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our results have been impacted, and we expect will continue to be impacted, by our ability to close large transactions.  The amount of revenue attributable to large transactions, and the number of such transactions, may vary significantly from quarter to quarter based on customer purchasing decisions and macroeconomic conditions.  Such transactions may have long lead times as they often follow a lengthy product selection and evaluation process and, for existing customers, are influenced by contract expiration cycles.  In addition, our revenue results quarter to quarter are impacted by contract terms, including duration and start dates of our subscription contracts.  These factors may cause volatility in our results. </span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">28</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><div product group and by geographic region below. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Core Product revenue growth was driven by growth in subscription revenue, offset by an expected decline in perpetual revenue due to the end of sales of perpetual licenses at the end of the first quarter of 2019.  Total recurring revenue for Core Products grew 24% (26% on a constant currency basis) compared to the prior year period. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Growth Product revenue growth was driven by 54% (55% constant currency) subscription revenue growth compared to the prior year period, offset by a decline in support revenue. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The decline in FSG revenue reflects an 80% decline in perpetual license revenue, partially offset by 9% growth in subscription revenue compared to the prior year period. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue by Geographic Region</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">A significant portion of our total revenue is generated outside the U.S.  In 2019 and in the first three months of 2020, approximately 40% of total revenue was generated in Americas, 40% in Europe, and 20% in Asia Pacific.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:0px;font-size:10pt;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">29</span></div></div><hr Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">Americas revenue growth was driven by 22% growth in subscription revenue, partially offset by a decline in support revenue resulting in 10% overall growth in recurring revenue compared to the prior year period.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">Europe revenue growth was driven by 92% (101% constant currency) growth in subscription revenue, offset by a decline in support revenue resulting in 33% (39% constant currency) growth in recurring revenue compared to the prior year period.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;background-color:#ffffff;">Asia Pacific revenue declined primarily due to comparison to the strong first quarter of 2019, which benefited from the last time purchases of perpetual licenses in that quarter associated with the discontinuation of perpetual license sales as of January 1, 2019.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:8pt;"> below.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">License gross margin increased for the first three months of 2020 compared to the first three months of 2019 as revenue increased due to the maturity of the subscription model, expenses decreased due to lower compensation costs related to lower headcount, offset by increasing royalty expenses.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Support and cloud services gross margin decreased for the first three months of 2020 compared to the first three months of 2019, primarily due to an increase in costs associated with our cloud services business.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Professional services gross margin decreased for the first three months of 2020 compared to the first three months of 2019, primarily due to an increase in compensation costs related to higher headcount. </span></div><div style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">In the first </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, our effective tax rate differed from the statutory federal income tax rate of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">21%</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> due to U.S. tax reform, our corporate structure in which our foreign taxes are at a net effective tax rate lower than the U.S. rate, the excess tax benefit related to stock-based compensation and the indirect effects of the adoption of ASC 606.  Additionally, in the first </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;">three</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> months of </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and 2019, we reduced the U.S. valuation allowance by </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">$21.0 million</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and $1.8 million as the result of the Onshape and Frustum acquisitions, respectively.  A significant amount of our foreign earnings is generated by our subsidiaries organized in Ireland.  In </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2020</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">, the foreign rate differential predominantly relates to these Irish earnings.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Operating Measures</span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">31</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">ARR</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">ARR represents the annualized value of our portfolio of recurring customer arrangements as of the end of the reporting period, including subscription software, cloud, and support contracts.  </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">We believe ARR is a valuable operating metric to measure the health of a subscription business because it captures expected subscription and support cash generation from customers, existing customer expansions, and includes the impact of total churn, which reflects churn, offset by the impact of any pricing increases.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;text-indent:30px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Because this measure represents the annualized value of recurring customer contracts as of the end of a reporting period, ARR does not represent revenue for any particular period or remaining revenue that will be recognized in future periods. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Non-GAAP Financial Measures </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">Our non-GAAP financial measures and the reasons we use them and the reasons we exclude the items identified below are described in Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the year ended September 30, 2019. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:6px;padding-top:6px;text-indent:32px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:Century Gothic,sans-serif;font-size:10pt;">The non-GAAP financial measures presented in the discussion of our results of operations and the respective most directly comparable GAAP measures are:</span></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:96px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td revenue</span></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:6px;padding-bottom:6px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td
